javadoc:
Base class for managing properties that are accessed by an index. Property
 values are determined by the derived class.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the size (in bytes) of the data that is stored in this property
 set.
@return the size (in bytes) of the data that is stored in this property
 set.
methods.name: getDataSize
methods.comment:
Returns the size (in bytes) of the data that is stored in this property
 set.

return.comment:
the size (in bytes) of the data that is stored in this property
 set.

methods.javadoc: Get the name for this property manager.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Get the name for this property manager.

methods.javadoc: Returns property object class associated with this set.
methods.name: getObjectClass
methods.comment: Returns property object class associated with this set.

methods.name: intersects
methods.comment:
Given two indices it indicates whether there is an index in
 that range (inclusive) having the property.

params.name: start
params.comment: the start of the index range.

params.name: end
params.comment: the end of the index range.

return.comment:
boolean true if at least one index in the range
 has the property, false otherwise.

methods.name: removeRange
methods.comment: Removes all property values within a given range.

params.name: start
params.comment: begin range

params.name: end
params.comment: end range, inclusive

return.comment:
true if any property value was removed; return
 		false otherwise.

methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Remove the property value at the given index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the long representation of an address.

return.comment:
true if the property value was removed, false
   otherwise.

methods.javadoc:
returns whether there is a property value at index.
@param index the long representation of an address.
methods.name: hasProperty
methods.comment: returns whether there is a property value at index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the long representation of an address.

methods.name: getNextPropertyIndex
methods.comment: Get the next index where the property value exists.

params.name: index
params.comment: the address from which to begin the search (exclusive).

throws.comment:
thrown if there is no address with
   a property value after the given address.

methods.name: getPreviousPropertyIndex
methods.comment: Get the previous index where a property value exists.

params.name: index
params.comment:
the long representation of an address from which
 		to begin the search (exclusive).

throws.comment:
when there is no index
 		with a property value before the given address.

methods.javadoc:
Get the first index where a property value exists.
@throws NoSuchIndexException when there is no property value for any index.
methods.name: getFirstPropertyIndex
methods.comment: Get the first index where a property value exists.

throws.comment: when there is no property value for any index.

methods.javadoc:
Get the last index where a property value exists.
@exception NoSuchIndexException thrown if there is no address having the property value.
methods.name: getLastPropertyIndex
methods.comment: Get the last index where a property value exists.

methods.javadoc:
Get the number of properties in the set.
@return the number of properties
methods.name: getSize
methods.comment: Get the number of properties in the set.

methods.name: moveRange
methods.comment: Move the range of properties to the newStart index.

params.name: start
params.comment: the beginning of the property range to move

params.name: end
params.comment: the end of the property range to move

params.name: newStart
params.comment: the new beginning of the property range after the move

methods.name: getPropertyIterator
methods.comment:
Creates an iterator over all the indexes that have this property within
 the given range.

params.name: start
params.comment: The start address to search

params.name: end
params.comment: The end address to search

return.comment: LongIterator Iterator over indexes that have properties.

methods.name: getPropertyIterator
methods.comment:
Creates an iterator over all the indexes that have this property within
 the given range.

params.name: start
params.comment: The start address to search

params.name: end
params.comment: The end address to search

params.name: atStart
params.comment:
indicates if the iterator should begin at the start
 address, otherwise it will start at the last address.  Set this flag to
 false if you want to iterate backwards through the properties.

return.comment: LongIterator Iterator over indexes that have properties.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator over the indices having the given property
 value.
methods.name: getPropertyIterator
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator over the indices having the given property
 value.

methods.name: getPropertyIterator
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator over the indices having the given property
 value.

params.name: start
params.comment: the starting index for the iterator.

methods.name: getPropertyIterator
methods.comment:
Returns an iterator over the indices having the given property
 value.

params.name: start
params.comment: the starting index for the iterator.

params.name: before
params.comment: if true the iterator will be positioned before the start value.

methods.name: saveProperties
methods.comment: Saves all property values between start and end to the output stream

params.name: oos
params.comment: the output stream

params.name: start
params.comment: the first index in the range to save.

params.name: end
params.comment: the last index in the range to save.

throws.comment: if an I/O error occurs on the write.

methods.name: restoreProperties
methods.comment:
Restores all the properties from the input stream.  Any existing
 properties will first be removed.

params.name: ois
params.comment: the input stream.

throws.comment:
if the a class cannot be determined for
 the property value.

methods.name: saveAll
methods.comment: Saves all properties to the given output stream.

params.name: out
params.comment: the output stream.

throws.comment: I/O error occurs while writing output.

methods.name: restoreAll
methods.comment: Restores all properties values from the input stream.

params.name: in
params.comment: the input stream.

throws.comment: if I/O error occurs while reading from stream.

if the a class cannot be determined for
 the property value.

methods.name: applyValue
methods.comment:
Based upon the type of property manager that this is, the appropriate
 visit() method will be called within the PropertyVisitor.

params.name: visitor
params.comment: object implementing the PropertyVisitor interface.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address of where to visit (get) the property.

name: PropertySet
comment:
Base class for managing properties that are accessed by an index. Property
 values are determined by the derived class.
